I was afflicted by grief for my son,
my mind was disturbed, I was confused;
I was naked, with my hair disheveled,
wandering here and there.
In the streets, in the charnel ground,
in the wilderness, and on the roads,
I wandered for three years,
afflicted by hunger and thirst.
Then I saw the Fortunate One,
in the city of MithilÄ;
The one who tames the untamed,
the Buddha, fearless in every way.
Having regained my composure,
I bowed down and sat down;
He taught me the Dhamma,
the compassionate Gotama.
Having heard that Dhamma,
I went forth into homelessness;
Applying myself to the Teacherâ€™s word,
I realized the auspicious state.
All my grief is cut off,
abandoned without remainder;
The bases are fully understood by me,
from which grief could arise.â€
